verses.text: The burden of the word of the \sc Lord\sc* for Israel, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, Which stretcheth forth the heavens, and layeth the foundation of the earth, And formeth the spirit of man within him.
Behold, I \add will\add* make Jerusalem a cup of trembling unto all the people round about, When they shall be in the siege both against Judah \add and\add* against Jerusalem.
And in that day will I make Jerusalem a burdensome stone for all people: All that burden themselves with it shall be cut in pieces, Though all the people of the earth be gathered together against it.

In that day, saith the \sc Lord\sc*, I will smite every horse with astonishment, and his rider with madness: And I will open mine eyes upon the house of Judah, And will smite every horse of the people with blindness.
And the governors of Judah shall say in their heart, The inhabitants of Jerusalem \add shall be\add* my strength In the \sc Lord\sc* of hosts their God.

In that day will I make the governors of Judah like a hearth of fire among the wood, And like a torch of fire in a sheaf; And they shall devour all the people round about, on the right hand and on the left: And Jerusalem shall be inhabited again in her own place, \add even\add* in Jerusalem.
The \sc Lord\sc* also shall save the tents of Judah first, That the glory of the house of David And the glory of the inhabitants of Jerusalem Do not magnify \add themselves\add* against Judah.

In that day shall the \sc Lord\sc* defend the inhabitants of Jerusalem; And he that is feeble among them at that day shall be as David; And the house of David \add shall be\add* as God, As the angel of the \sc Lord\sc* before them.
And it shall come to pass in that day, \add That\add* I will seek to destroy all the nations That come against Jerusalem.

And I will pour upon the house of David, and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem, The spirit of grace and of supplications: And they shall look upon me whom they have pierced, And they shall mourn for him, as one mourneth for \add his\add* only \add son\add*, And shall be in bitterness for him, as one that is in bitterness for \add his\add* firstborn.
In that day shall there be a great mourning in Jerusalem, As the mourning of Hadad-rimmon in the valley of Megiddon.
And the land shall mourn, every family apart; The family of the house of David apart, and their wives apart; The family of the house of Nathan apart, and their wives apart;
The family of the house of Levi apart, and their wives apart; The family of Shimei apart, and their wives apart;
All the families that remain, Every family apart, and their wives apart.
